qas.question: Who did Madonna turn to for comfort during her mother's illness?
How did the Ciccone siblings behaved towards anyone brought to their home to replace their beloved mother?
Who did Madonna tell in an interview that as a young girl, she was lonely and always searching for something?
Afraid that Tony would be taken from her, what does she do?

answers.text: unable to sleep unless she was near him

context: Madonna turned to her <a0_0>paternal grandmother<a0_0/> for solace. The Ciccone siblings resented housekeepers and invariably <a1_0>rebelled<a1_0/> against anyone brought into their home ostensibly to take the place of their beloved mother. Madonna later told <a2_0>Vanity Fair<a2_0/> that she saw herself in her youth as a "lonely girl who was searching for something. I wasn't rebellious in a certain way. I cared about being good at something. I didn't shave my underarms and I didn't wear make-up like normal girls do. But I studied and I got good grades.... I wanted to be somebody." Terrified that her father Tony could be taken from her as well, Madonna was often <a3_0>unable to sleep unless she was near him<a3_0/>.
